meanings.definition: A person who washes clothes for a living.
meanings.sent1: The dhobi collected the dirty clothes from the customers.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood dhobi is known for his efficient laundry services.
meanings.sent3: The dhobi accidentally mixed up the colors and turned all the white shirts pink!
meanings.sent4: She worked like a dhobi, tirelessly scrubbing away at the stains of the past.
meanings.sent5: The dhobi's hands were rough from years of washing and scrubbing garments.

meanings.sent1: The dhobi folded the freshly washed clothes neatly.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the dhobi would start his day at the laundry shop.
meanings.sent3: The dhobi joked with his colleagues while hanging the clothes out to dry.
meanings.sent4: She was a dhobi by day, ensuring every piece of clothing was spotless.
meanings.sent5: The dhobi's apron was stained with soap suds and detergent marks.

meanings.sent1: She would dhobi the clothes by hand in the old-fashioned way.
meanings.sent2: The washing machine can dhobi a large load of laundry at once.
meanings.sent3: He decided to dhobi the clothes himself instead of taking them to the laundromat.
meanings.sent4: The rain outside would naturally dhobi the clothes hanging on the line.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed gently, its waters able to dhobi the garments clean.
